result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian I Chairez

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Christian I Chairez not in court, in custody.  Student Intern Caroline  Pelligrini supervised by Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Witness Coordinator: mperkin. Victim ( MH) appears via zoom.

Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Christian I Chairez not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties agree that case is mis-tabbed and should be assigned to Branch 45.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 45.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian I Chairez in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin; both appear by video.  Defendant Christian I Chairez in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MLH or DH.

Defendant Christian I Chairez in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Christian I Chairez in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian I Chairez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT HAS RETAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
